channel.title: Science : NPR
channel.description: The latest health and science news. Updates on medicine, healthy living, nutrition, drugs, diet, and advances in science and technology. Subscribe to the Health & Science podcast.

item.title: Tesla Begins Taking Orders For Its Solar Energy Roof Tile Systems
item.description: May 11, 2017 - Tesla offers an "infinity" warranty on its tiles that integrate solar power into roof coverings. The company has published a web tool that can estimate costs and savings
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 11, 2017 - Tesla offers an "infinity" warranty on its tiles that integrate solar power into roof coverings. The company has published a web tool that can estimate costs and savings http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/05/11/527930243/tesla-begins-taking-orders-for-its-solar-energy-roof-tile-systems

item.title: Lead Dust From Firearms Can Pose A Silent Health Risk
item.description: May 10, 2017 - The Department of Defense has increased protections for military personnel from exposure to lead from firearms. It can be a health problem for people using recreational shooting ranges, too.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 10, 2017 - The Department of Defense has increased protections for military personnel from exposure to lead from firearms. It can be a health problem for people using recreational shooting ranges, too. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/10/527648768/lead-dust-from-firearms-can-pose-a-silent-health-risk

item.title: Why Do Children Love Those Fad Toys So?
item.description: May 10, 2017 - Today it's fidget spinners, but soon it will be another little gizmo that children dearly, desperately want. The complicated social dynamics of childhood are one big reason.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 10, 2017 - Today it's fidget spinners, but soon it will be another little gizmo that children dearly, desperately want. The complicated social dynamics of childhood are one big reason. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/10/527769527/why-do-children-love-those-fad-toys-so

item.title: How Illegal Gold Mining Relates To The Spread Of Malaria
item.description: May 10, 2017 - New social science research shows a correlation between illegal gold mining and the spread of malaria. We explore why this might be the case.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 10, 2017 - New social science research shows a correlation between illegal gold mining and the spread of malaria. We explore why this might be the case. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/10/527720163/how-illegal-gold-mining-relates-to-the-spread-of-malaria

item.title: Primitive Humanlike Species Lived More Recently Than Expected
item.description: May 9, 2017 - The surprising finding suggests that small-brained Homo naledi may have lived at the same time as early humans in South Africa, complicating previous notions about human origins.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 9, 2017 - The surprising finding suggests that small-brained Homo naledi may have lived at the same time as early humans in South Africa, complicating previous notions about human origins. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/05/09/527624658/primitive-human-like-species-lived-more-recently-than-expected

item.title: Australian Fossils Hint At Where To Search For Life On Mars
item.description: May 9, 2017 - Scientists say the rocks lend weight to a theory that life on Earth originated, as Darwin wrote, "in some warm little pond" on land, suggesting we should look for it in similar environments on Mars.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 9, 2017 - Scientists say the rocks lend weight to a theory that life on Earth originated, as Darwin wrote, "in some warm little pond" on land, suggesting we should look for it in similar environments on Mars. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/05/09/527575457/australian-fossils-hint-at-where-to-search-for-life-on-mars

item.title: 'Baby Dragon' Found In China Is The Newest Species Of Dinosaur
item.description: May 9, 2017 - The Beibeilong was a giant, birdlike dinosaur that lived some 90 million years ago. Scientists say it had massive feathered wings and a birdlike skull and could grow to more than 26 feet long.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 9, 2017 - The Beibeilong was a giant, birdlike dinosaur that lived some 90 million years ago. Scientists say it had massive feathered wings and a birdlike skull and could grow to more than 26 feet long. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/05/09/527440895/baby-dragon-found-in-china-is-the-newest-species-of-dinosaur

item.title: Magic, Or Math? The Appeal Of Coincidences, And The Reality
item.description: May 8, 2017 - This week on Hidden Brain: coincidences. Why they're not quite as magical as they seem, and the psychological reasons we can't help but search for meaning in them anyway.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 8, 2017 - This week on Hidden Brain: coincidences. Why they're not quite as magical as they seem, and the psychological reasons we can't help but search for meaning in them anyway. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/08/527442620/magic-or-math-the-appeal-of-coincidences-and-the-reality

item.title: Is A Stradivarius Violin Easier To Hear? Science Says Nope
item.description: May 8, 2017 - Old Italian violins like those made by Stradivari are famous for their ability to project their sound. But a study found people in a blind test thought new violins projected better than old ones.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 8, 2017 - Old Italian violins like those made by Stradivari are famous for their ability to project their sound. But a study found people in a blind test thought new violins projected better than old ones. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/08/527057108/is-a-stradivarius-violin-easier-to-hear-science-says-nope

item.title: Trump's Budget Would Eliminate A Key Funder Of Research On Coastal Pollution
item.description: May 8, 2017 - The Sea Grant program, which funds research on coastal environments, is slated by White House for elimination in 2018. If it goes, a project that finds leaking septic tanks goes down the drain, too.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 8, 2017 - The Sea Grant program, which funds research on coastal environments, is slated by White House for elimination in 2018. If it goes, a project that finds leaking septic tanks goes down the drain, too. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/08/527095737/trumps-budget-would-eliminate-a-key-funder-of-research-on-coastal-pollution

item.title: Secret U.S. Space Plane Lands With A Boom In Florida
item.description:
May 8, 2017 - For a secret aircraft, the X-37B wasn't very stealthy about its return to Earth. The space plane was launched in 2015.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/05/08/527374507/secret-u-s-space-plane-lands-with-a-boom-in-florida
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: NASA Has A Spacesuit Shortage
item.description: May 7, 2017 - NASA has only 11 spacesuits in use, and they were designed decades ago. Spacesuit designer Pablo de Leon tells Lulu Garcia-Navarro about how the shortage affects operations in space.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 7, 2017 - NASA has only 11 spacesuits in use, and they were designed decades ago. Spacesuit designer Pablo de Leon tells Lulu Garcia-Navarro about how the shortage affects operations in space. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/07/527250368/nasa-has-a-spacesuit-shortage

item.title: Crayola Gives The People What They Want: A New Blue Crayon
item.description: May 5, 2017 - After Crayola announced it was retiring the yellow crayon Dandelion, the company said its replacement would be blue, but would it be a true blue? No, it's actually an accidental blue.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 5, 2017 - After Crayola announced it was retiring the yellow crayon Dandelion, the company said its replacement would be blue, but would it be a true blue? No, it's actually an accidental blue. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/05/526808319/crayola-gives-the-people-what-they-want-a-new-blue-crayon

item.title: Why Taste Buds Dull As We Age
item.description: May 5, 2017 - You're born with roughly 9,000 taste buds, and they're very good at regenerating — which is why you can recover the ability to taste just days after burning your tongue. But that can change as we age.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 5, 2017 - You're born with roughly 9,000 taste buds, and they're very good at regenerating — which is why you can recover the ability to taste just days after burning your tongue. But that can change as we age. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/05/05/526750174/why-taste-buds-dull-as-we-age

item.title: Denmark Now Has A Wild Wolf Pack Again — For The First Time In 200 Years
item.description: May 4, 2017 - Citing CCTV footage and DNA samples, two researchers say a female has migrated more than 340 miles from Germany to join a small group of wolves in the Jutland peninsula.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 4, 2017 - Citing CCTV footage and DNA samples, two researchers say a female has migrated more than 340 miles from Germany to join a small group of wolves in the Jutland peninsula. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/05/04/526937018/denmark-now-has-a-wild-wolf-pack-again-for-the-first-time-in-200-years
